conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine speed difference trend.
Object A has a constant velocity from t = 0 to t1.
Object B has a decreasing velocity from t = 0 to t1.
Difference in speed is represented by vertical distance between graphs.
At t = 0, the difference in speed is 0.
As time progresses, the difference in speed decreases.
Difference in speed decreases continuously from t = 0 to t1.
Difference in speed is not continuously increasing.
Final Answer: No, the difference in speed is not continuously increasing.
